meanings.definition: To make (something) ready or suitable for exposure to the weather.
meanings.sent1: The workers weatherized the house by sealing all the windows and doors.
meanings.sent2: Before the storm, they weatherized the outdoor furniture by covering it with waterproof material.
meanings.sent3: The family decided to weatherize their picnic area by setting up a tent in case of rain.
meanings.sent4: She weatherized her garden by planting sturdy plants that could withstand harsh weather conditions.
meanings.sent5: The sailors weatherized the ship by reinforcing the hull to prevent leaks during the storm.

meanings.definition: To protect (something) from the effects of weather.
meanings.sent1: The farmers weatherized their crops by covering them with protective sheets during the frost.
meanings.sent2: Homeowners often weatherize their windows with insulation to keep the cold air out.
meanings.sent3: The campers weatherized their tent by securing it tightly to the ground to prevent it from blowing away in the wind.
meanings.sent4: The zookeepers weatherized the animal enclosures to ensure the animals stayed warm during the winter.
meanings.sent5: The construction workers weatherized the building by applying a weather-resistant coating to the exterior walls.
